page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: This block is a very rural area and is split between the three parishes of Great Leighs , Great Waltham , and Terling. It has woodland covering about 5% of the area and 85% is arable cultivation, the majority of the crops being Wheat and Barley with some oil seed Rape.There are one or two fields left as meadow land. There are 21 farm houses within this area , but most of them are now used as private houses.The land is owned by other people and companies, one of whom is Lord Rayleighs Farms, Lord Rayleigh himself living in Terling Place in the village. There is a small industrial area where a firm manufactures paper and plastic bags.
